Quando la Privacy Guard√® abilitato, %s non sar√† in grado di accedere ai dati personali quali contatti, messaggi, posizione o registri delle chiamate.

Abilitando Privacy Guard per il %s applicazioni incorporato, l\'applicazione non sar√† in grado di accedere ai dati personali quali contatti, messaggi, posizione o registri delle chiamate. Ci√≤ pu√≤ causare un errato funzionamento delle altre applicazioni.
Non accedere ai dati personali di default per le applicazioni appena installate
Mostra notifica se privacy guard √® attivo.
Gestisce quali applicazioni hanno accesso ai vostri dati personali e altre autorizzazioni delle applicazioni
Non ci sono applicazioni con autorizzazioni pertinenti installate

In this screen you can choose for which apps Privacy Guard should be active by simply tapping on them. Selected apps will not be able to access your personal data, such as contacts, messages, location or call logs. Long pressing on an entry allows to set specifically app permissions.\n\nBy default built-in apps are not shown. If you want to show them or filter apps to show only the ones requesting access to personal data by their permissions, select the respective options in the menu.
Selected app does not request permissions which access personal data. Do you want to modify the other permissions?
Reset all permissions back to default?
This app has no changeable permissions.

Abbreviated day of the week before the time
Display custom date before the clock
Must be in DateFormat eg. MM/dd/yy

Double tap status bar or lock screen slider to put the device to sleep

Never show ongoing notifications from this app on the lockscreen

Changing your default LCD density can sometimes cause certain apps to not function properly and/or the playstore to show apps being incompatible with your device
Tablets generally use 160 dpi while high end devices use 320 or 480 dpi. Older devices use 240 dpi
You need to reboot your device for your change to take effect
Changing your default LCD density can sometimes cause certain apps to not function properly and/or the playstore to show apps being incompatible with your device\"

, while selecting the icon will bring up customization options

To add a %1$s, select the Add icon. Once a %1$s is added, selecting the row will change the target%2$s

To remove a %1$s, swipe the row horizontally left or right. Re-order a %1$s in the list by vertically dragging the anchor on the left.

To clear or reset to defaults, select the Reset icon.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the feature entirely.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the second pie layer entirely.

This will hide all force close notificaitons

Choose a default expanded desktop style
Don\'t send touch events for navigation and status bar gestures to apps
You don\'t have any blacklisted numbers. Add an entry by touching the Add (+) button.
To blacklist calls and/or messages from certain numbers, enable the blacklist.
Incoming calls and messages from phone numbers in the blacklist will be blocked
Don\'t block calls from private numbers
Don\'t block calls or messages from numbers not in the contact list
Block incoming %s from numbers not in the contact list
Use . as a wildcard and * for repetition. E.g. 123.* blocks numbers starting with 123 and .*123.* blocks numbers containing 123

Enter primary email account and associated password to reset pattern lock

To get started tap the edit icon to unlock the navigation bar for editing.

You can tap an icon to change its shortcut, or long press an icon to re-arrange the layout.

Tap save to commit your changes, or restore to reset the layout to default settings.
Change and arrange navigation bar buttons
Delete current settings and restore the default layout?
Display left and right cursor buttons while typing. Overrides IME switcher.
Edit and re-arrange navigation ring shortcuts

Tap the edit icon to open the navigation ring for editing.

Select a target to configure its behavior.

Tap the check mark icon to save your changes, or restore to reset the settings to defaults.
Top pie does not show status and clock information
Change the button icon color mode
To avoid conflicts with status bar or navigation bar, the triggers on these edges are automatically turned off if one or both are available
Mirror right pie on the horizontal axis
Shows snap points to change the trigger edge dynamically
Shows phone status, time and date information
